properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Jarvis Creek. 
  • There is a tree on fire at Lake Road, Jarvis Creek that is under control.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Lake Road, Jarvis Creek
Issue Date: Sunday 21 December 2025, 09:41 pm
Next Update: Monday 22 December 2025, 10:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38817/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Jarvis Creek. 
- There is a tree on fire at Lake Road, Jarvis Creek that is under control.
- Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Goomalibee.
  • This Community Information message replaces the Advice message issued at 1:30pm today. 
  • The large grassfire that has been burning in Goomalibee, between Tarnook Road and the Broken River, is under control. 
  • Small fires may still be burning in this area, and firefighters are patrolling the fire with heavy plant and machinery to completely extinguish it.  
  • Beware of dangerous tree hazards. 
  • Smoke may still be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Only local traffic can travel in this area. See below for more information on road closures.
These are at: 
  • intersection of Goomalibee Road and Tarnook Road 
  • intersection of Tarnook Road and Burness Road 
  • intersection of Terret Rd and Goomalibee Road.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - GRASS FIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Goormalibee
Issue Date: Sunday 21 December 2025, 08:56 pm
Next Update: Monday 22 December 2025, 12:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38816/moreinfo

This Community Information is being issued for Goomalibee.
- This Community Information message replaces the Advice message issued at 1:30pm today. 
-   The large      grassfire that has been burning in Goomalibee,      between Tarnook Road and the Broken River, is under control. 
-   Small fires      may still be burning in this area, and firefighters      are patrolling the fire with heavy plant and machinery to completely extinguish it.  
- Beware of dangerous tree hazards.  
- Smoke may      still be visible from nearby communities and roads.
- Only local traffic can travel in this area. See below for more information on road closures.
These are at: 
- intersection      of Goomalibee Road and Tarnook Road 
- intersection      of Tarnook Road and Burness Road 
- intersection      of Terret Rd and Goomalibee Road.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Charlton, Yeungroon East, Yeungroon.
  • The grassfire at Resevoir-Parish Rd,Charlton  is now under control,but fire is still burning in a number of trees and stumps. 
  • Emergency services will continue to monitor.
  • The following roads remain closed while being accessed for damage: Charlton-St Arnaud Road, Yeungroon Road and River Road.
  • Check the VicTraffic website for all current road closures https://traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information message replaces the Advice message issued on Saturday 20-12-2025 at 11:49AM.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - GRASS FIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Resevoir-Parish Rd,Charlton Issue Date: Sunday 21 December 2025, 11:51 am Next Update: Monday 22 December 2025, 12:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38802/moreinfo This Community Information is being issued for Charlton, Yeungroon East, Yeungroon. - The grassfire at Resevoir-Parish Rd,Charlton is now under control,but fire is still burning in a number of trees and stumps. - Emergency services will continue to monitor. - The following roads remain closed while being accessed for damage: Charlton-St Arnaud Road, Yeungroon Road and River Road. - Check the VicTraffic website for all current road closures https://traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/ - Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. - This Community Information message replaces the Advice message issued on Saturday 20-12-2025 at 11:49AM. There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Wyperfeld National Park and Patchewollock, Yaapeet, Hopetoun
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Wyperfeld National Park and Patchewollock, Yaapeet, Hopetoun. 
  • There is a bushfire at Wyperfeld National Park - North South Track that is under control.
  • Fire crews are continuing to patrol the area. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 11.51 AM.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: 17.3 kilometres south of Patchewollock
Issue Date: Sunday 21 December 2025, 06:01 pm
Next Update: Monday 29 December 2025, 12:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38815/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Wyperfeld National Park and Patchewollock, Yaapeet, Hopetoun. 
- There is a bushfire at Wyperfeld National Park - North South Track that is under control.
- Fire crews are continuing to patrol the area. 
- This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 11.51 AM.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
